review_text: This cabin was one of the most comfortable Airbnb stays we have had, nothing fussy, just a well organized home. We were traveling with our golden retriever who enjoyed sitting for hours on the porch...we had to drag her off when it was time to leave! There is a great dog park in town and afterwords took our pup to the fountains where she tried to catch the water jetting up. One day we drove to Lost Maples park and did a beautiful hike. We cooked all of our meals in the cabin, did our laundry, and enjoyed watching movies at night from their comfortable couch. Unlike our other hosts, they take care of all cleanup (no stripping sheets, etc). A great value and a great find.

name: John
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2023
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
The most relaxing vacation I've had in a long time. In many ways better than more "major" trips, like cruises, visits to big cities, etc. Taylor was a gracious host. She was quick to respond when I had a question, and very respectful of our privacy.
We were able to visit Fredericksburg, take some hikes, found a few fossils, and had a perfect view of the annular eclipse.
This region of Texas has its own allure. My first time visiting the Hill Country. Found it charming.
The closest thing to a negative has nothing to do with Taylor or the venue. I drive a Tesla, and the nearest Superchargers are in Junction, Johnson City, or Leon Springs, all 40-50 miles away. As with any long trip in a Tesla, (I drove 1200 miles from home) plan accordingly. It's just Texas is so big that what looks like a short distance on a map can turn out to be further than expected. Kerrville is big enough and busy enough to have a Supercharger location.

review_text: Super cute, clean place in a lovely neighborhood. The only worrisome moment we had was their dog ran up and barked at us when we were sitting on the porch with my dog. Taylor was really responsive and apologetic when I asked her about the dog and says they usually are really careful about keeping an eye on him when guests are there and that he is friendly. We had a great stay, though, loved the cabin, and found Taylor very responsive and nice.

name: Jung
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
April 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The location, just a few miles outside downtown Ingram was secluded. The views were great; neighbor's peacocks calling each night give it an exotic feel. Note: with the windows closed, I couldn't hear them at all.
The HVAC controls were simple to use.
WiFi was fast as described but disconnected from the Internet during the wee late night hours (e.g., 2 AM). This is likely an ISP's modem "feature." The solution was to restart WiFi on my phone/device which would trigger the modem to reconnect to the Internet.
It'd rained during two days of our stay and the laundry machines got some use. Both the washer and dryer were quiet and convenient.
The bathroom and kitchen were clean.
The rooms had plenty of closet space and hangers but I'd recommend adding a dresser or something with drawers for small clothes.
We appreciated the Keurig and the assortment of coffees.
Overall, a good value and would recommend to others.

review_text:
We were looking for a location with darker skies to use our telescope and try to see some cool astronomical objects. Taylor's Kerrville cabin was a great location, far darker than where we live, and we had good viewing of star clusters, a couple of nebulas, Saturn, Jupiter, etc. etc.
During the days, we hiked at Enchanted Rock and did some exploring in Fredericksburg (the Pacific War Museum is amazing). The cabin's location is quiet and peaceful and very beautiful. The cabin interior is exactly as depicted, with charming knotty pine and lots of windows. The main living/kitchen area is one big open space, which is the perfect layout when you're on vacation. It was comfy and also very clean and tidy. Taylor and her husband were both super kind and helpful. We had a great stay here!

You are about12-15 minutes to the center of Kerrville, but the magnificent views really makeup for any additional travel time. The space is perfect for families with 3 big bedrooms, new comfortable beds and sprawling yards. Your pets will enjoy the fully enclosed yard area. The decks and outside spaces are wonderful.
If you're looking for easy access to bars and restaurants, this is probably not for you. If you want to enjoy the beauty of nature in a comfortable convenient space. This is for you.

review_text: I can think of any number of reasons why The Kinsleigh House would be just right for families needing a sweet spot in Kerrville, but thiswas our situation, perfectly accommodated by this cozy clean home away from home. Our son and DIL were about to have a baby at Peterson and we were to be in charge of their 3 yo son. He loves homey places so I got the feeling that a small house would be better than a hotel room where he could have his own room, have the run of the place, we could cook meals, visit the nearby public library, and get to new baby sister at Peterson in just minutes when called. It worked! After a comfy late nap in "his room," it took just minutes to get big bro to the "hopistable". He said he liked "our house" but wanted to take the baby to his house. We received immediate responses for any questions we asked of our hosts and everything we needed was clean and at our disposal. This whole scenario but just couldn't have been any better than it was! Thank you so much

While this maybe located on 19 acres, this home is not private. You enter through a gate surrounded by multiple trailers/homes being renovated. We could hear people nearby but they did not bother us. It is not practical to walk around. Parking for more than 2 cars would be challenging. The owner was super quick to answer questions and help us. The kitchen was pretty well stocked and we were even able to cook a pizza in the toaster oven. I would definitely return!

The house itself is really neat and fresh. There is so much natural light (blinds on all the windows, though so no worry about early morning sun in your face,) and a stunning view. The deck is perfect for watching the sun set and taking in the natural beauty of the area.
The hosts were excellent with communication and were so nice and friendly. They gave us complete privacy, though so you can stay here and not talk to a single soul if that is your preference.
Quite literally my favorite Airbnb to date. I wouldnâ€™t change a single thing. If we are ever back in the area we wonâ€™t even look for another place!

I think one of the reviews described the experience as melting into the bed. The Keurig was definitely a bonus, I drank so much coffee and tea. I loved it so much, we'll probably plan another trip back here, whether to just relax or check out the surroundings.

review_text: This little hidden gem was probably the best AirBnB that we've stayed at so far. Very quiet and peaceful location and the cabin was clean and modern. Just big enough to house all your needs from a small kitchen to a sofa and tv for relaxation. Elena and Butch are great at the small details and that is what makes the experience so special. They have snacks and a cute greeting card when you arrive and even provide a binder with important information that you may need such as great restaurants nearby, things to do and even emergency contact info. I was very impressed with their attention to details. I kept messaging her and they always responded which I appreciated. We even got to see deer grazing in front of our cabin which was beautiful to see. Plus small hummingbirds visited us one morning. The one issue we had was a small ant problem with our pastries but maybe that was our fault for leaving it out. The beds and shower were delicious. I loved that the shower was so spacious and you melted in the bed. The top bedroom is huge but not for tall people so just keep that in mind. Either way we would love to stay again as it really provided that private and safe space for relaxation. Thank you so much Elena and Butch. You have a wonderful little getaway space. Be blessed!

review_text: What a wonderful place to stay, with incredible hosts! The view from the deck is just lovely, and so peaceful. Coffee and snacks were thoughtfully provided (and very much appreciated). Elena and Butch were kind, responsive, and welcoming hosts; we did have a small issue with red wasps having built a nest under the deck (a worry with our small kids), but when we messaged Elena and Butch about it they responded within minutes, and we were able to get the nest taken care of that very day. We've stayed in several lovely AirBnBs on family trips now, but this was by far our favorite experience.

name: Stephen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a one room (with a loft) cottage with a very Texas hill country feel. Tucked into a secluded hillside neighborhood of eclectic homes and cottages there are deer roaming the yards morning and evening. The cottage has a separate parking space that is easy to get into and back out of when you leave. The cottage is down a sloping walk/driveway with three stairs to the patio. Not accessible if you have mobility issues. The room is well lit with three sets of lights. The bed is very comfortable. The cottage is set up for two and that's all it can accommodate. It has a fully functional kitchen with everything you need to make your own meals, which we utilized. All the utilities worked well and cleaning supplies were adequate for washing dishes, pots, etc. There is a closet in the utility room for hanging clothes. Lots of extra pillows and blankets! The heating/cooling unit worked very well and kept the room toasty in the sub-freezing temperatures. Overall very satisfied.

However, our time was short and we wanted to explore the outdoors as it was our first time in Kerrville - We visited Enchanted Rock, Louis Hays Park, the Cross and a couple of restaurants. The first morning, we woke up to 4 deer in the yard. A lot of beauty to enjoy. We had no issues or questions however we could tell that our host were available, if needed. The communication ahead of our arrival was helpful, hospitable and reassuring that we would enjoy our stay - which we did! We were able to make some great memories. Thanks again for sharing your home! We hope to be back to make more memories there.

Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Jennifer's place. It was quiet, clean, and a great place to retreat to after a busy day. Jennifer was great about communicating and went above and beyond, providing us with coffee and breakfast foods. Her husband also came to show us how to use the washer and dryer so that we could do laundry our last night. We appreciated having everything we needed in the kitchen to reheat food so we didn't have to eat out every night. We drove into Kerrville each day for a training and it only took us 8 minutes, which was nice.
The one negative, as many others have said in their reviews, is that you can hear them walking upstairs when they are above the bedroom and it is quite loud. If you are a light sleeper, ear plugs are definitely recommended! My husband had a hard time getting to sleep the first night because of the noise, so we went out and bought some.
If you are looking for a quiet getaway just outside of town, this is a great option!

Where we stayed at Jennifer's was one of several she rents out. We were on a ground level with a private entrance, bath & nicely stocked small kitchen. The room was spacious with a desk and a place to hang clothing and a table to sit at. The bathroom was a small, but adequate with sink, toilet and shower and private only to us.
She made check in simple by asking us what code we would like to have to open the door; great idea! She left us fresh cut fruit and also asked what our preference on drinks would be, which is a great idea. We had a personal request of her while there, and she was very responsive to answer us on that.
The reason we cannot give her 5 stars is the fact that someone was above us and we could hear them moving around when we tried to turn in for the evenings; super annoying. We could not hear music or TV's or voices, but definitely could hear people moving and it was loud; right above where we were trying to sleep. We could not recommend based on this issue.

we had a wonderful stay at jenniferâ€™s air bnb, she was friendly, great at communication and the room was extremely clean. the room was a lot bigger than we expected, with a great size bathroom (with a shower in the bath which made it easier for me to bathe my infant as a lot of places only offer a shower) and the kitchen area was also amazing! it was fully stocked with all of the utensils, silverware, plates, glasses, blender, coffee machine, fridge, microwave, toaster oven and plug in stove. the bed was extremely comfortable and the personalized pin for the doors made things super convenient. the house was right on the golf course with beautiful views, and in the evening we even saw a deer! it was great to sit outside in the morning and eat breakfast. :)
also to add, the smart tv, fast wifi and fully stocked bathroom with all of the hair products you could need during a visit was a PERFECT additive! i didnâ€™t even think to bring shampoo and conditioner and realized as i was unpacking i had forgotten it, but jennifer had the bathroom stocked with all of that. the location felt extremely safe and was quiet. we will definitely be returning to stay at this place when weâ€™re back in kerrville!

review_text: This fabulous Hill Country getaway on River Hills golf course exceeded expectations. The ground floor room made for easy access and easy loading and unloading from the nearby parking spot. The well appointed spacious room was clean, welcoming, and very comfortable! A delightful breakfast and delicious coffee was provided. Each morning, we were greeted by a family of four deer in the safe and quiet neighborhood. The host was available at all times to answer questions. We value the hospitality and generosity of the host. The big bonus: we were able to watch the world series on the large TV! ,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I was very impressed with the property and with my hosts. The communication was excellent before and during my visit. They were warm and welcoming when I arrived, with clear explanations about the room and the house. Jenn provided well-thought out recommendations on local attractions and activities.

The room is accessed from the first floor through the main door. It felt very private, secluded and serene. The room is very spacious, very clean, and tastefully decorated. There was fruit and bottled water in the room, which I thought was lovely touch - well beyond what I had expected. Also stocked with hair care products and body lotions to try. The bed was very comfortable - I slept very soundly. The spacious driveway near the room, so parking and unloading my car was easy.

I enjoyed coffee on the deck and chatting with Jenn and her husband in the mornings. They were friendly without being intrusive. The views from the deck were pretty amazing. I watched a herd of deer grazing on the golf course, while sipping my coffee and checking my email. It is on the bottom floor with rooms over, so I did hear footsteps in the morning, but was not bothersome (I am a very light sleeper, but it didn't wake me). I am already planning my next visit!

name: Anie
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
August 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: It was an unlocked rental. It was night time and in a retail area with a business parking lot. I did not know if there was someone in the house, so I had to check it out before bringing my small children inside. The door only locks with the key, and there's no deadbolt, so anyone else with that key could have entered. I ended up sleeping on the couch for safety. There's also a kitchen door to a back alley with glass. I needed to use the restroom in a hurry, one door was missing to the toilet and the other door to the shower area I shut behind me. As I was using the restroom, the door swung back open and the windows had no blinds and curtains in bedroom were open so anyone in the parking lot could see me. That door only stays shut if locked from the inside-not childproof. I could not find an outlet in bathroom to get ready. Restaurant doesn't serve breakfast, which was why I chose to stay there for room service. Breakable stuff at knee height & on every surface so I had to move it up.

Stayed with kids
review_text: My husband, toddler and I booked last minute for a weekend trip and were very pleased with our stay at the Sleepy Side of Rails. The owners were very responsive any time we communicated, the place was clean and was as described. There was an AC mishap the day we arrived and Melissa, her husband and staff got right on it! Things cooled down and while we waited, we were treated to dinner and drinks at Rails! Our server, Kai was very helpful and friendly with local recommendations. The location is in a very walkable area. We went to Pint and Plow for dinner and for coffee the next morning. The Louise Hays park and trail system is within walking/jogging distance and is worth checking out. For families, there are two playgrounds for them to get some energy out. My toddler enjoyed the kid friendly toys that were available at Sleepy side as well.

review_text:
My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at The Sleepy Side of Rails. The historic structure was nicely renovated. I particularly liked the restored hard pine floors, as well as the original moldings and windows. There were enough modern conveniences to make it comfy and cozy.
Our first few nights were wonderful. On our last night, in the middle of a Central Texas heat wave, the air conditioning went out. Our host, Melissa, went above and beyond to insure our comfort that night and booked us a hotel room nearby. A true super host.
We would definitely stay again when we return to Kerrville.

You are sure to experience Melissa's care for her customers through the attention to detail in decorating and furnishing the home in such a way that you feel immediately welcomed and comfortable. It is centrally located and near many good restaurants. We enjoyed peace and quiet that resulted in a great night's sleep. Our only disappointment is that we could not stay longer! God bless you Melissa for your care and kindness!!!
